If the equipment is old it may not be possible to fix.

I advised voice caller to tell the TTY caller he is asking the opr to re-read the last sentence.  I also advised voice caller to disconnect and call back into Relay to get a different opr.  Voice says opr's in the past have read what he asked them to.  Supe informed voice this was not proper procedure.  Voice was loud, rude and then hung up on supe.  (TTY user was informed of this conversation and disconnected once voice hung up).  Discussion was held w/opr and from what was seen and from what was heard from the voice person, this opr did her job properly.  Opr 8388 was very upset that the caller was upset.  Voice was apologized to and voice was not happy w/our procedures but that proper procedure was followed.  Voice hung up.

Resolution_Description: Resolutions, respectively:  1)  Traffic had been heavy & new trunk line had been recently installed.  Explained that callers could receive "all circuits busy" when line was tied up w/traffic.  2)  Customer's friends are infrequent or inexperienced users of Relay and they call from work on phones that are probably unbranded, resulting in ASCII search which would explain Fax (TTY) tones.  3)  Customer's phone is branded so it must be a tech problem. The problem must be caused by the local phone co. and customer will need to contact them because of the way they have 711 calls being connected to relay.  If the equipment is old it may not be possible to fix.
